Key Match Events: Ireland bowled superbly to restrict England to 105 for five when rain stopped play
Captain Andy Balbirnie’s 62 off 47 balls underpinned Ireland’s 157 all out
Fionn Hand, in his third T20 and first match of the tournament, castled Ben Stokes through the gate
Dawid Malan was England’s top scorer with 35
Moeen Ali counter-attacked amid a drizzle with 24 not out off 12 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland have blown this Super 12s group wide open with England needing to win their three remaining fixtures to finish in the top two
England suffered a major T20 World Cup setback as Ireland claimed another momentous victory over their rivals
Miscellaneous Highlights: The only previous T20 between these teams in 2010 was also impacted by rain, which forced a no-result
Rain had led to two brief delays at the outset of the contest after Ireland had been asked to bat first
The delay proved terminal as England, on 105 for five when the downpour started, slipped to a five-run defeat under the DLS method
Others: England’s hopes of reaching the semi-finals have been dealt a significant blow
Ireland got off to a flyer on Wednesday with Chris Woakes leaking 41 from his three overs
England’s bowlers struggled for rhythm, particularly early on
